structure.unit: Crimes, Punishments And Proceedingsin Criminal Cases

law.catch_line: Imitation Of Furs; False Representation; Prohibition
law.text: Whoever, himself, or by his agent or servant, or as the agent or servant of another person, sells or exchanges, or has in his custody or possession with intent so to do, or exposes for sale or exchange, any manufactured imitations of furs of fur-bearing animals, representing the same to be the genuine fur of certain animals, shall be punished by a fine of not less than two hundred nor more than five hundred dollars.
